text: KalibangƒÅn is a prehistoric site at in Rajasthan. It is on the left or southern banks of the Ghaggar (Ghaggar-Hakra River), India. It is on a triangle-shaped piece of land at the confluence of Drishadvati and Sarasvathi Rivers.McIntosh, Jane (2008) The Ancient Indus Calley : New Perspectives. ABC- CLIO. Page 77 A report on the excavations at the site were published in 2003 by the Archaeological Survey of India, 34 years after the completion of excavations. The report said that Kalibangan was a major provincial capital in the Indus Valley. Discoveries at Kalibangan include unique fire altars and world's earliest known ploughed field. There is also evidence of two types of burials, namely circular graves and rectangular graves. ==References== Category:Ancient India Category:Ancient settlements Category:3rd millennium BC buildings and structures
